channel.title: WSJ.com: World News
channel.copyright: Copyright © Dow Jones & Company, Inc. All rights reserved.

item.title: Boeing 787 Jet Bound for London Crashes in India With 242 on Board
item.description: The Air India flight crashed in a residential area shortly after takeoff. The Boeing model, known as the Dreamliner, hadn’t had a fatal incident in its 14 years of operation.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Pentagon Review of Aukus Security Pact Worries U.K., Australia
item.description: The review throws into doubt a strategic partnership that aims to give Australia nuclear-powered submarines and deter Chinese aggression in the Indo-Pacific.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Iran Says It Will Accelerate Nuclear Work After U.N. Atomic Agency Censure
item.description: The new nuclear steps will cast a fresh shadow over struggling U.S.-Iran nuclear talks.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Norman

item.title: Chinese Jets Tail Japanese Air Patrol in Close Encounter
item.description: Japan disclosed new details about China’s unprecedented show of force close to the U.S. partner’s shores over the weekend.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: Loudspeakers Go Quiet on Korean Border, Ending a Year of Audio Aggression
item.description: For a year or so, the two countries engaged in daily standoffs—the North pumping out animal wails and the South blaring boy-band music and news.
item.dc:creator: Timothy W. Martin

item.title: Supply Chains Become New Battleground in the Global Trade War
item.description: The U.S.-China talks on trade resemble arms-control negotiations, with export controls being the key weapons in each side’s arsenal.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: Where Russia Is Advancing in Ukraine and What It Hopes to Gain
item.description: Moscow’s latest offensive isn’t just about territorial gains: It is designed to make the West think a Kremlin victory is inevitable.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Barnett

item.title: U.S. Moves to Withdraw Some Middle East Personnel as Iran Tensions Rise
item.description: The State Department ordered all nonessential staff to leave the U.S. Embassy in Baghdad and authorized the departure of nonessential staff and families from Bahrain and Kuwait.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Dezember

item.title: The ‘Ghost of al-Qassam’ Becomes Hamas’s Third Leader in Seven Months
item.description: After Israel killed his two predecessors, Ezzedin al-Haddad takes over a militant group that is battered and depleted of veterans—but still deadly.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: Opinion | U.N. Fudges the Data on West Bank Violence
item.description: Even Palestinian terrorists are counted as victims of Israeli settlers.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Trump Has No China Trade Strategy
item.description: Washington and Beijing stage a tactical retreat that shows China’s leverage.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Chinese Spyware, Only $6.99
item.description: Nebraska sues Temu for siphoning sensitive data from Americans.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Trump’s Big Opportunity in Japan
item.description: A stronger alliance on trade and technology would benefit the U.S. while deterring China.
item.dc:creator: Mike Gallagher

item.title: Opinion | Will the U.S. Pull Its Weight in NATO?
item.description: Allies agree to spend 3.5% of GDP. America isn’t there yet.
item.dc:creator: Dustin Walker

item.title: China Puts Six-Month Limit on Its Ease of Rare-Earth Export Licenses
item.description: A tentative deal reached in London gives Beijing continued leverage in trade negotiations.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Bade

item.title: U.S. Ambassador to Canada Says Breakthrough Possible in Bilateral Talks at G-7 Summit
item.description: U.S. Ambassador to Canada Pete Hoekstra said that all indications point to the possibility of a good economic-and-security deal for both the U.S. and Canada.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Scores Killed in Heavy Flooding in South Africa
item.description: Torrential rain, severe winds and landslides have killed at least 49 people in the poverty-stricken Eastern Cape province of South Africa.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: Opinion | Nixing Iran’s Nukes Isn’t Impossible for Israel
item.description: Edward N. Luttwak writes a letter on targeting the Islamic Republic’s nuclear installations.

item.title: A Flawed Attempt at Delivering Gaza Aid Led to a Wave of Deaths
item.description: The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation was created to get food quickly to those who need it most. It soon ran into trouble.
item.dc:creator: Suha Ma’ayeh

item.title: China’s Lock on Rare Earths Dictated Path Toward Trade Truce
item.description: Control of minerals used in electronics has given Beijing powerful leverage in trade negotiations with the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Bade

item.title: Trump Says Deal Restoring China Trade Truce Is Done
item.description: President Trump said the U.S. deal with China to revive their trade truce was done, subject to final approval from him and Chinese leader Xi Jinping.
item.dc:creator: Lingling Wei

item.title: Tanzania’s First Female Leader Championed Human Rights. Now She’s Turning to Repression.
item.description: Critics of Samia Suluhu Hassan say she is clinging to power by locking up and torturing those who stand in her way.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Kimeu

item.title: Russia’s Top Peace Negotiator Is Historian Who Justified the War
item.description: Vladimir Medinsky warned, in an interview, that Ukraine would lose more territory if it doesn’t agree to Moscow’s demands.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: Far-Right Israeli Ministers Sanctioned by U.K., Canada and Others
item.description: A group of five countries said the two men incited violence against Palestinians in the West Bank, highlighting a growing divide between Israel and some of its Western allies.
item.dc:creator: David Luhnow

item.title: Israel Deports Greta Thunberg After Intercepting Gaza-Bound Activist Boat
item.description: The climate activist was flying to Sweden via France a day after Israeli forces intercepted her and a group of other volunteers on a sailboat attempting to take humanitarian aid to Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Jared Malsin

item.title: 10 Dead in Rare Austria School Shooting
item.description: The suspected attacker was a 21-year-old Austrian man and a former student at the school, authorities said.
item.dc:creator: Georgi Kantchev

item.title: ‘Those Who Should Be Seized Should Be Seized’ Review: A People Persecuted
item.description: Beijing at first denied the existence of camps for Xinjiang’s Muslims. Now the party calls them “vocational education and training centers.”

item.title: EU Proposes Nord Stream Ban, Cutting Oil Price Cap to Hit Russia
item.description: The European Union’s executive arm proposed banning transactions with Russia’s Nord Stream gas pipelines and cutting the price cap on Russian oil as part of its latest round of sanctions against the Kremlin.
item.dc:creator: Giulia Petroni

item.title: Carney Rules Out Tax Increases to Finance Higher Canada Defense Spending
item.description: Canada’s decision to ramp up military spending at a faster-than-expected pace marks a “significant event” for the country’s fiscal direction, Prime Minister Mark Carney said.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: China Extends Probe Into EU Pork Imports
item.description: China said it would extend a yearlong probe into pork imports from the European Union, as Beijing seeks to bolster ties with the 27-member bloc amid heightened trade tensions with the U.S.

item.title: Xi Tightens Leash on Officials’ Boozing and Lavish Living
item.description: The Chinese leader has revised frugality rules for party and state workers in a bid to extend his authority and save money.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: The Risky Mission to Salvage Mike Lynch’s Sunken Superyacht
item.description: The recovery operation is key to the criminal investigation into the Bayesian’s sinking, which killed seven people, including tech executive Mike Lynch. The effort was delayed after the death of a diver.
item.dc:creator: Peter Champelli

item.title: Gaza-Bound Activist Boat With Greta Thunberg Intercepted, Boarded by Israel
item.description: Activist Thunberg planned to bring humanitarian aid to Gaza in defiance of an Israeli blockade on the enclave.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: Canada to Boost Military Spending to Try to Placate Trump
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said Canada would spend money on military vehicles, drones, ammunition and sensors to monitor the Arctic.
item.dc:creator: Vipal Monga

item.title: China’s Navy Expands Its Reach With Aircraft Carrier Drills
item.description: A Chinese aircraft carrier is conducting drills hundreds of miles south of Japan’s main island, venturing into waters that could be strategically vital in a conflict with the U.S. in the Pacific.
item.dc:creator: Joyu Wang

item.title: Taiwan Tries to Purge Its Ranks of China Sympathizers
item.description: The government is stepping up scrutiny of members of the civil service and military for signs of misplaced allegiances.
item.dc:creator: Joyu Wang

item.title: Modern Tech and Old-School Spycraft Are Redefining War
item.description: Ukraine’s drone strike against Russia’s bomber fleet and Israel’s operations against Hezbollah show how technological advances and good tradecraft can potentially alter the course of wars.
item.dc:creator: Joe Parkinson

item.title: Colombian Presidential Hopeful Fights for His Life After Assassination Attempt
item.description: The shooting of Sen. Miguel Uribe sparks fears of a return to the blood-soaked political violence of the 1980s and ’90s.
item.dc:creator: Juan Forero

item.title: Soaring Gold Prices Draw Illicit Miners—and Armed Gangs—to Colombia’s Jungles
item.description: Colombia’s cartels add illegal gold-mining proceeds to their booming business.
item.dc:creator: Juan Forero

item.title: Trump Said What? Europe Suddenly Basks in White House Praise
item.description: Pledges to boost arms spending and trade talks have won allies a reprieve from the president’s barbs and threats. Officials are enjoying it but know it could pass quickly.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Michaels

item.title: Israel Is Putting More Women on the Front Line to Help Fix Its Manpower Problem
item.description: Female soldiers are entering the battlefield in Gaza, Lebanon and Syria in ways many previously thought impossible.

item.title: Canada Introduces Bill to Speed Up Project Approval, Dismantle Trade Barriers
item.description: The legislation aims to accelerate approval of resource and infrastructure projects, and knock down internal trade barriers that analysts estimate cost Canada’s economy tens of billions of dollars in growth.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Mystery Balloons Near Kim Jong Un’s Capsized Warship Puzzle Experts
item.description: North Korea confirmed its capsized warship was upright and stable, but a layer of intrigue lingers around the salvage work: Why the armada of massive balloons?
item.dc:creator: Dasl Yoon

item.title: North Korea Races to Fix Capsized Warship by Kim’s Deadline
item.description: The ship, which had flipped on its side and partially sank after a botched launch, is now back upright.
item.dc:creator: Timothy W. Martin

item.title: South Korean Left-Leaning Candidate Wins Presidential Election
item.description: The victory by Lee Jae-myung, who has warned against South Korea becoming overly dependent on the U.S., could lead to a shift in Seoul’s relations with China and North Korea.
item.dc:creator: Soobin Kim

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Selinger

item.title: Ukraine Says It Destroyed Dozens of Warplanes Deep Inside Russia
item.description: The clandestine drone attack deals the biggest blow of the war against Moscow’s long-range bomber fleet.
item.dc:creator: Jane Lytvynenko

item.title: Putin Has Retooled Russia’s Economy to Focus Only on War
item.description: Moscow has expanded military recruitment and boosted weapons production. Peace could jeopardize the resulting economic gains.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Trump Says Putin Is ‘Playing With Fire’
item.description: The president has indicated he is weighing additional sanctions on Russia, potentially as soon as this week.
item.dc:creator: Annie Linskey

item.title: South African Leader Pushes Back on Trump’s ‘Genocide’ Claims in Tense Meeting
item.description: Cyril Ramaphosa is visiting the White House after relations with the U.S. deteriorated over race, Israel and trade.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: Rebels in Captured City Force Residents to Clean Sewers and Morgues at Gunpoint
item.description: M23 insurgents backed by Rwanda are wielding their new authority harshly after taking over a city in eastern Congo.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Can a School Play Be a Threat to the State? Kenya’s Leaders Seem to Think So
item.description: President William Ruto and his former party chief have clashed over “Echoes of War” and its themes of a worsening generational divide.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Kimeu

item.title: British Police Investigate Fires at Properties Linked to Prime Minister
item.description: British counterterrorism police are probing a string of suspected arson attacks on two properties linked to Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: U.K. Plans to Tighten Rules After Record Influx of Migrants
item.description: Britain’s government said a record influx of foreigners since Brexit had done little to energize the economy.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: India, Pakistan Cease-Fire Brokered by U.S. Appears to Hold
item.description: The neighbors had agreed to a full and immediate cease-fire in the worst violence between them for more than two decades.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Who Joined Putin in Moscow to Celebrate Victory Day
item.description: More than 20 world leaders gathered in Red Square to mark the 80th anniversary of the victory over Nazi Germany.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Men Found Guilty of Felling Famous Tree in ‘Moronic Mission’ That Gripped U.K.
item.description: The pair’s destruction of the beloved Sycamore Gap tree stoked nationwide anger and a criminal investigation.
item.dc:creator: Alistair MacDonald

item.title: BOE Set For Modest Rate Cuts As Inflation Stays High, NIESR Says
item.description: Inflation is likely to remain stubbornly high this year, the National Institute of Economic and Social Research said as it cut is 2025 growth forecast for the U.K.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: ‘Trump With a Pint’: How Nigel Farage Is Upending British Politics
item.description: The populist politician’s Reform UK party is soaring in the polls—and doing better at the ballot box—as voters lose patience with slow economic growth and high immigration.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: JD Vance Sees an India That America Can Work With
item.description: The vice president says India and the U.S. are making progress in trade talks.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: India Has a Golden Opportunity to Capture U.S. Business From China
item.description: The world’s most populous nation has long trailed not just China but also smaller countries with nimbler governments.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: The Best Laptop Backpacks, According to CEOs, Pilots and Stylists
item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.
item.dc:creator: Sal Vaglica

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
item.dc:creator: Nick Guy

item.title: Modi Positions India as Ally in Trump’s Illegal-Immigration Fight
item.description: India’s leader has supported the deportation of Indian citizens as New Delhi looks to safeguard U.S. relations and protect H-1B visas.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: This Indian Festival Hosts More Pilgrims Than the Population of the U.S.
item.description: At least 400 million people are estimated to have attended the event, believed to be at least two millennia old and now drawing to a close.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Families Battle Tech Giants as Australia Pushes for an Under-16 Social-Media Ban
item.description: The proposal marks the latest effort by political leaders worldwide to regulate children’s use of platforms, amid concerns that it is harming their mental health.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘We’ve Got to Kill’: Inside New Zealand’s Mission to Wipe Out Predators
item.description: Scientists debate whether a multibillion-dollar plan to eliminate invasive animals by 2050 is feasible.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: France’s Macron Tries to Quell New Caledonia Riots With Globe-Crossing Trip
item.description: The French leader said he is open to suspending a voting-rights bill that sparked the riots once order is restored on the archipelago and talks resume between rival factions.
item.dc:creator: Stacy Meichtry

item.title: France Rushes Reinforcements to Riot-Stricken New Caledonia
item.description: Unrest in the overseas territory could derail President Emmanuel Macron’s efforts to restore French influence in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Australia to Boost Defense Spending Amid U.S.-China Tensions
item.description: Australia is boosting its defense budget and rethinking its defense plans as strategic competition between the U.S. and China heats up in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney
